title: How to Make Matcha and Chocolate Swirl Cake

steps.headline: Melt the chocolate using a double boiler and add the unsweetened cocoa powder and milk.
Melt the butter in a separate bowl.
Sift flour and baking powder into a large bowl.
steps.description: To the same bowl add eggs, sugar, and melted butter and mix well.

steps.headline: Divide the batter into two halves.To the first batter, add matcha tea powder and mix well.
steps.description: To the second batter, add the melted chocolate and mix well.

steps.headline: Grease 6-8 small cupcake molds and coat with an even thin layer of flour.
steps.description: (The flour will stick to the greased mold, invert the mold to remove any excess flour).

steps.headline: Pour half chocolate then half matcha into each mold, fill to about 3/4 full (the cake will expand as it cooks).
steps.description: With the back of a spoon make a swirling movement in the batter mixture. This will create a beautiful marble effect in the cake.

steps.headline: Bake in 350ºF or 180ºC degree in a preheated oven for 30 minutes.
Serve with milk or unsweetened tea.

text: Melt the chocolate using a double boiler and add the unsweetened cocoa powder and milk.  Melt the butter in a separate bowl.  Sift flour and baking powder into a large bowl. To the same bowl add eggs, sugar, and melted butter and mix well. Divide the batter into two halves.To the first batter, add matcha tea powder and mix well. To the second batter, add the melted chocolate and mix well. Grease 6-8 small cupcake molds and coat with an even thin layer of flour. (The flour will stick to the greased mold, invert the mold to remove any excess flour). Pour half chocolate then half matcha into each mold, fill to about 3/4 full (the cake will expand as it cooks). With the back of a spoon make a swirling movement in the batter mixture. This will create a beautiful marble effect in the cake. Bake in 350ºF or 180ºC degree in a preheated oven for 30 minutes.  Serve with milk or unsweetened tea.
